2021.title: The Hunt for Red October
2021.thoughts: I've generally enjoyed Tom Clancy novels, and this movie was done well. Connery & Baldwin do a great job.

2021.title: Breach
2021.thoughts: I had only heard of Robert Hanssen, while dramatized, this did fill in some of the gaps. Great acting by Cooper and Ryan Phillipe.

2021.title: The Highwaymen
2021.thoughts: I enjoyed this telling of the end of Bonnie & Clyde. Costner & Harrelson did a fantastic job.

2021.title: The Departed
2021.thoughts: This had been on my list to watch for a while. It was a good movie, but I guess I didn't feel like the ending was as satisfying as I hoped it would be.

2021.title: Gordon Lightfoot: If You Could Read My Mind
2021.thoughts: My Dad often listened to Gordon Lightfoot while I was growing up, so needless to say, I've grown an appreciation for his music. This was an interesting documentary about his life and history with folk music.

2021.title: Moneyball
2021.thoughts: As a baseball fan, and a fan of Michael Lewis' writing, I loved the story of how baseball has probably seen its biggest change in the last 50 years with how teams are built and players evaluated.

2021.title: 9to5: The Story of a Movement
2021.thoughts: I always knew that women have had it tough in the workplace. This documentary gave me a much better understanding of the fight they've undertaken.

2021.title: The Current War
2021.thoughts: I went into this thinking this was an Edison vs. Tesla movie and was pleasantly surprised that it was far more than that.

2021.title: Sherlock Holmes
2021.thoughts: Wasn’t a horrible adaptation of Sherlock Holmes, but I still prefer Sherlock & Elementary.

2021.title: Hotel Artemis
2021.thoughts: I'm still not sure how I feel about the movie, but it has a fantastic cast.

2021.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
2021.thoughts: This is my second favorite original Trek movie. Coming out right around the end of the Cold War, this does a good job relating to that time in history.

2021.title: Skyfall
2021.thoughts: Definitely my favorite Daniel Craig Bond film. The interaction between Judi Dench as 'M' and Craig really shines here.

2021.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
2021.thoughts: As much as I love Star Trek, the only redeeming part of this movie is probably Kirk's "What does God need with a starship?" line

2021.title: Capital in the 21st Century
2021.thoughts: Informative and disheartening at the same time. This documentary does a good job of looking back at what led to the current economic inequality and the rigged system.

2021.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
2021.thoughts: Star Trek & time travel...often a fun mix.

2021.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
2021.thoughts: Being an odd-numbered Trek film, this one often gets overlooked. It’s still one of my favorites.

2021.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
2021.thoughts: The quintessential Star Trek film. Definitely one of the best, if not the best Trek film.

2021.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
2021.thoughts: Better than I remember it, but awfully slow.

2021.title: Quantum of Solace
2021.thoughts: Not one of the better Bond films. Still a decent action flick.

2021.title: The Game Changers
2021.thoughts: This was an interesting documentary about plant based diets. Part of me felt it was trying to sell me on the idea of going more plant based, but it does follow other things I’ve read. Worth a watch.

2021.title: The Prestige
2021.thoughts: The twists and turns of this movie were enjoyable. Christian Bale and Hugh Jackman did phenomenal jobs.

2020.title: Casino Royale
2020.thoughts: Daniel Craig does a fantastic job stepping into the role of 007 in this. The casting all around is fantastic.

2020.title: Die Another Day
2020.thoughts: Brosnan's final film as Bond is another good one.

2020.title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
2020.thoughts: I really enjoyed the intrigue in this one. It did take me a little to pick out the characters though.

2020.title: Hail, Caesar!
2020.thoughts: This was definitely a Coen Brothers film. It was solid, not as funny as I expected, but still good.

2020.title: The Nice Guys
2020.thoughts: I enjoyed this one. Russell Crowe and Ryan Gosling play well off each other.

2020.title: The Death of Stalin
2020.thoughts: Can't say I really understood this one.

2020.title: The World is Not Enough
2020.thoughts: Definitely better than I remembered it.

2020.title: The Royal Tenenbaums
2020.thoughts: I wasn't a huge fan of this one. It had a few moments here and there, but overall I didn't really get it.

2020.title: Man of the Year
2020.thoughts: I seem to remember liking this movie a lot more when I first saw it. Still not bad.

2020.title: Goldeneye
2020.thoughts: Still one of the best Bond films out there. A great intro to Pierce Brosnan as 007.
